00109 char obd_jobid_var[JOBSTATS_JOBID_VAR_MAX_LEN + 1] = JOBSTATS_DISABLE;

00113 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_memory);

00115 
00116 char obd_jobid_node[LUSTRE_JOBID_SIZE + 1];
00117 
00118 /* Get jobid of current process by reading the environment variable
00119  * stored in between the "env_start" & "env_end" of task struct.
00120  *
00121  * TODO:
00122  * It's better to cache the jobid for later use if there is any
00123  * efficient way, the cl_env code probably could be reused for this
00124  * purpose.
00125  *
00126  * If some job scheduler doesn't store jobid in the "env_start/end",
00127  * then an upcall could be issued here to get the jobid by utilizing
00128  * the userspace tools/api. Then, the jobid must be cached.
00129  */
00130 int lustre_get_jobid(char *jobid)
00131 {
00132         int jobid_len = LUSTRE_JOBID_SIZE;
00133         int rc = 0;
00134         ENTRY;
00135 
00136         memset(jobid, 0, LUSTRE_JOBID_SIZE);
00137         /* Jobstats isn't enabled */
00138         if (strcmp(obd_jobid_var, JOBSTATS_DISABLE) == 0)
00139                 RETURN(0);
00140 
00141         /* Whole node dedicated to single job */
00142         if (strcmp(obd_jobid_var, JOBSTATS_NODELOCAL) == 0) {
00143                 memcpy(jobid, obd_jobid_node, LUSTRE_JOBID_SIZE);
00144                 RETURN(0);
00145         }
00146 
00147         /* Use process name + fsuid as jobid */
00148         if (strcmp(obd_jobid_var, JOBSTATS_PROCNAME_UID) == 0) {
00149                 snprintf(jobid, LUSTRE_JOBID_SIZE, "%s.%u",
00150                          current_comm(),
00151                          from_kuid(&init_user_ns, current_fsuid()));
00152                 RETURN(0);
00153         }
00154 
00155         rc = cfs_get_environ(obd_jobid_var, jobid, &jobid_len);
00156         if (rc) {
00157                 if (rc == -EOVERFLOW) {
00158                         /* For the PBS_JOBID and LOADL_STEP_ID keys (which are
00159                          * variable length strings instead of just numbers), it
00160                          * might make sense to keep the unique parts for JobID,
00161                          * instead of just returning an error.  That means a
00162                          * larger temp buffer for cfs_get_environ(), then
00163                          * truncating the string at some separator to fit into
00164                          * the specified jobid_len.  Fix later if needed. */
00165                         static bool printed;
00166                         if (unlikely(!printed)) {
00167                                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x16b, "%s value too large "
00168                                                    "for JobID buffer (%d)\n",
00169                                                    obd_jobid_var, jobid_len);
00170                                 printed = true;
00171                         }
00172                 } else {
00173                         CDEBUG((rc == -ENOENT || rc == -EINVAL ||
00174                                 rc == -EDEADLK) ? D_INFO : D_ERROR,
00175                                "Get jobid for (%s) failed: rc = %d\n",
00176                                obd_jobid_var, rc);
00177                 }
00178         }
00179         RETURN(rc);
00180 }
00181 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_get_jobid);
00182 
00183 static int class_resolve_dev_name(__u32 len, const char *name)
00184 {
00185         int rc;
00186         int dev;
00187 
00188         ENTRY;
00189         if (!len || !name) {
00190                 CERROR("No name passed,!\n");
00191                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00192         }
00193         if (name[len - 1] != 0) {
00194                 CERROR("Name not nul terminated!\n");
00195                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00196         }
00197 
00198         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "device name %s\n", name);
00199         dev = class_name2dev(name);
00200         if (dev == -1) {
00201                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "No device for name %s!\n", name);
00202                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00203         }
00204 
00205         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "device name %s, dev %d\n", name, dev);
00206         rc = dev;
00207 
00208 out:
00209         RETURN(rc);
00210 }
00211 
00212 int class_handle_ioctl(unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00213 {
00214         char *buf = NULL;
00215         struct obd_ioctl_data *data;
00216         struct libcfs_debug_ioctl_data *debug_data;
00217         struct obd_device *obd = NULL;
00218         int err = 0, len = 0;
00219         ENTRY;
00220 
00221         /* only for debugging */
00222         if (cmd == LIBCFS_IOC_DEBUG_MASK) {
00223                 debug_data = (struct libcfs_debug_ioctl_data*)arg;
00224                 libcfs_subsystem_debug = debug_data->subs;
00225                 libcfs_debug = debug_data->debug;
00226                 return 0;
00227         }
00228 
00229         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "cmd = %x\n", cmd);
00230         if (obd_ioctl_getdata(&buf, &len, (void __user *)arg)) {
00231                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: data error\n");
00232                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00233         }
00234         data = (struct obd_ioctl_data *)buf;
00235 
00236         switch (cmd) {
00237         case OBD_IOC_PROCESS_CFG: {
00238                 struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00239 
00240                 if (!data->ioc_plen1 || !data->ioc_pbuf1) {
00241                         CERROR("No config buffer passed!\n");
00242                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00243                 }
00244                 OBD_ALLOC(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00245                 if (lcfg == NULL)
00246                         GOTO(out, err = -ENOMEM);
00247                 err = copy_from_user(lcfg, data->ioc_pbuf1,
00248                                          data->ioc_plen1);
00249                 if (!err)
00250                         err = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00251                 if (!err)
00252                         err = class_process_config(lcfg);
00253 
00254                 OBD_FREE(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00255                 GOTO(out, err);
00256         }
00257 
00258         case OBD_GET_VERSION:
00259                 if (!data->ioc_inlbuf1) {
00260                         CERROR("No buffer passed in ioctl\n");
00261                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00262                 }
00263 
00264                 if (strlen(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING) + 1 > data->ioc_inllen1) {
00265                         CERROR("ioctl buffer too small to hold version\n");
00266                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00267                 }
00268 
00269                 memcpy(data->ioc_bulk, LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING,
00270                        strlen(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING) + 1);
00271 
00272                 err = obd_ioctl_popdata((void __user *)arg, data, len);
00273                 if (err)
00274                         err = -EFAULT;
00275                 GOTO(out, err);
00276 
00277         case OBD_IOC_NAME2DEV: {
00278                 /* Resolve a device name.  This does not change the
00279                  * currently selected device.
00280                  */
00281                 int dev;
00282 
00283                 dev = class_resolve_dev_name(data->ioc_inllen1,
00284                                              data->ioc_inlbuf1);
00285                 data->ioc_dev = dev;
00286                 if (dev < 0)
00287                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00288 
00289                 err = obd_ioctl_popdata((void __user *)arg, data,
00290                                         sizeof(*data));
00291                 if (err)
00292                         err = -EFAULT;
00293                 GOTO(out, err);
00294         }
00295 
00296         case OBD_IOC_UUID2DEV: {
00297                 /* Resolve a device uuid.  This does not change the
00298                  * currently selected device.
00299                  */
00300                 int dev;
00301                 struct obd_uuid uuid;
00302 
00303                 if (!data->ioc_inllen1 || !data->ioc_inlbuf1) {
00304                         CERROR("No UUID passed!\n");
00305                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00306                 }
00307                 if (data->ioc_inlbuf1[data->ioc_inllen1 - 1] != 0) {
00308                         CERROR("UUID not NUL terminated!\n");
00309                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00310                 }
00311 
00312                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "device name %s\n", data->ioc_inlbuf1);
00313                 obd_str2uuid(&uuid, data->ioc_inlbuf1);
00314                 dev = class_uuid2dev(&uuid);
00315                 data->ioc_dev = dev;
00316                 if (dev == -1) {
00317                         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "No device for UUID %s!\n",
00318                                data->ioc_inlbuf1);
00319                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00320                 }
00321 
00322                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "device name %s, dev %d\n", data->ioc_inlbuf1,
00323                        dev);
00324                 err = obd_ioctl_popdata((void __user *)arg, data,
00325                                         sizeof(*data));
00326                 if (err)
00327                         err = -EFAULT;
00328                 GOTO(out, err);
00329         }
00330 
00331         case OBD_IOC_GETDEVICE: {
00332                 int     index = data->ioc_count;
00333                 char    *status, *str;
00334 
00335                 if (!data->ioc_inlbuf1) {
00336                         CERROR("No buffer passed in ioctl\n");
00337                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00338                 }
00339                 if (data->ioc_inllen1 < 128) {
00340                         CERROR("ioctl buffer too small to hold version\n");
00341                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00342                 }
00343 
00344                 obd = class_num2obd(index);
00345                 if (!obd)
00346                         GOTO(out, err = -ENOENT);
00347 
00348                 if (obd->obd_stopping)
00349                         status = "ST";
00350                 else if (obd->obd_set_up)
00351                         status = "UP";
00352                 else if (obd->obd_attached)
00353                         status = "AT";
00354                 else
00355                         status = "--";
00356                 str = (char *)data->ioc_bulk;
00357                 snprintf(str, len - sizeof(*data), "%3d %s %s %s %s %d",
00358                          (int)index, status, obd->obd_type->typ_name,
00359                          obd->obd_name, obd->obd_uuid.uuid,
00360                          atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount));
00361                 err = obd_ioctl_popdata((void __user *)arg, data, len);
00362 
00363                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
00364         }
00365 
00366         }
00367 
00368         if (data->ioc_dev == OBD_DEV_BY_DEVNAME) {
00369                 if (data->ioc_inllen4 <= 0 || data->ioc_inlbuf4 == NULL)
00370                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00371                 if (strnlen(data->ioc_inlbuf4, MAX_OBD_NAME) >= MAX_OBD_NAME)
00372                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00373                 obd = class_name2obd(data->ioc_inlbuf4);
00374         } else if (data->ioc_dev < class_devno_max()) {
00375                 obd = class_num2obd(data->ioc_dev);
00376         } else {
00377                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: No device\n");
00378                 GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00379         }
00380 
00381         if (obd == NULL) {
00382                 CERROR("OBD ioctl : No Device %d\n", data->ioc_dev);
00383                 GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00384         }
00385         LASSERT(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00386 
00387         if (!obd->obd_set_up || obd->obd_stopping) {
00388                 CERROR("OBD ioctl: device not setup %d \n", data->ioc_dev);
00389                 GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00390         }
00391 
00392         switch(cmd) {
00393         case OBD_IOC_NO_TRANSNO: {
00394                 if (!obd->obd_attached) {
00395                         CERROR("Device %d not attached\n", obd->obd_minor);
00396                         GOTO(out, err = -ENODEV);
00397                 }
00398                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: disabling committed-transno notification\n",
00399                        obd->obd_name);
00400                 obd->obd_no_transno = 1;
00401                 GOTO(out, err = 0);
00402         }
00403 
00404         default: {
00405                 err = obd_iocontrol(cmd, obd->obd_self_export, len, data, NULL);
00406                 if (err)
00407                         GOTO(out, err);
00408 
00409                 err = obd_ioctl_popdata((void __user *)arg, data, len);
00410                 if (err)
00411                         err = -EFAULT;
00412                 GOTO(out, err);
00413         }
00414         }
00415 
00416  out:
00417         if (buf)
00418                 obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
00419         RETURN(err);
00420 } /* class_handle_ioctl */
00421 
00422 #define OBD_INIT_CHECK
00423 #ifdef OBD_INIT_CHECK
00424 static int obd_init_checks(void)
00425 {
00426         __u64 u64val, div64val;
00427         char buf[64];
00428         int len, ret = 0;
00429 
00430         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "LPU64=%s, LPD64=%s, LPX64=%s\n", LPU64, LPD64, LPX64);
00431 
00432         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "OBD_OBJECT_EOF = "LPX64"\n", (__u64)OBD_OBJECT_EOF);
00433 
00434         u64val = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
00435         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "u64val OBD_OBJECT_EOF = "LPX64"\n", u64val);
00436         if (u64val != OBD_OBJECT_EOF) {
00437                 CERROR("__u64 "LPX64"(%d) != 0xffffffffffffffff\n",
00438                        u64val, (int)sizeof(u64val));
00439                 ret = -EINVAL;
00440         }
00441         len = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), LPX64, u64val);
00442         if (len != 18) {
00443                 CWARN("LPX64 wrong length! strlen(%s)=%d != 18\n", buf, len);
00444                 ret = -EINVAL;
00445         }
00446 
00447         div64val = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
00448         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "u64val OBD_OBJECT_EOF = "LPX64"\n", u64val);
00449         if (u64val != OBD_OBJECT_EOF) {
00450                 CERROR("__u64 "LPX64"(%d) != 0xffffffffffffffff\n",
00451                        u64val, (int)sizeof(u64val));
00452                 ret = -EOVERFLOW;
00453         }
00454         if (u64val >> 8 != OBD_OBJECT_EOF >> 8) {
00455                 CERROR("__u64 "LPX64"(%d) != 0xffffffffffffffff\n",
00456                        u64val, (int)sizeof(u64val));
00457                 return -EOVERFLOW;
00458         }
00459         if (do_div(div64val, 256) != (u64val & 255)) {
00460                 CERROR("do_div("LPX64",256) != "LPU64"\n", u64val, u64val &255);
00461                 return -EOVERFLOW;
00462         }
00463         if (u64val >> 8 != div64val) {
00464                 CERROR("do_div("LPX64",256) "LPU64" != "LPU64"\n",
00465                        u64val, div64val, u64val >> 8);
00466                 return -EOVERFLOW;
00467         }
00468         len = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), LPX64, u64val);
00469         if (len != 18) {
00470                 CWARN("LPX64 wrong length! strlen(%s)=%d != 18\n", buf, len);
00471                 ret = -EINVAL;
00472         }
00473         len = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), LPU64, u64val);
00474         if (len != 20) {
00475                 CWARN("LPU64 wrong length! strlen(%s)=%d != 20\n", buf, len);
00476                 ret = -EINVAL;
00477         }
00478         len = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), LPD64, u64val);
00479         if (len != 2) {
00480                 CWARN("LPD64 wrong length! strlen(%s)=%d != 2\n", buf, len);
00481                 ret = -EINVAL;
00482         }
00483         if ((u64val & ~PAGE_CACHE_MASK) >= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
00484                 CWARN("mask failed: u64val "LPU64" >= "LPU64"\n", u64val,
00485                       (__u64)PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00486                 ret = -EINVAL;
00487         }
00488 
00489         return ret;
00490 }
00491 #else
00492 #define obd_init_checks() do {} while(0)
00493 #endif
00494 
00495 static int __init obdclass_init(void)
00496 {
00497         int i, err;
00498 
00499         spin_lock_init(&obd_stale_export_lock);
00500         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd_stale_exports);
00501         atomic_set(&obd_stale_export_num, 0);
00502 
00503         LCONSOLE_INFO("Lustre: Build Version: "LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING"\n");
00504 
00505         spin_lock_init(&obd_types_lock);
00506         obd_zombie_impexp_init();
00507 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00508         obd_memory = lprocfs_alloc_stats(OBD_STATS_NUM,
00509                                          LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_NONE |
00510                                          LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE);
00511         if (obd_memory == NULL) {
00512                 CERROR("kmalloc of 'obd_memory' failed\n");
00513                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00514         }
00515 
00516         lprocfs_counter_init(obd_memory, OBD_MEMORY_STAT,
00517                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX,
00518                              "memused", "bytes");
00519 #endif
00520         err = obd_init_checks();
00521         if (err == -EOVERFLOW)
00522                 return err;
00523 
00524         class_init_uuidlist();
00525         err = class_handle_init();
00526         if (err)
00527                 return err;
00528 
00529         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd_types);
00530 
00531         err = misc_register(&obd_psdev);
00532         if (err) {
00533                 CERROR("cannot register %d err %d\n", OBD_DEV_MINOR, err);
00534                 return err;
00535         }
00536 
00537         /* This struct is already zeroed for us (static global) */
00538         for (i = 0; i < class_devno_max(); i++)
00539                 obd_devs[i] = NULL;
00540 
00541         /* Default the dirty page cache cap to 1/2 of system memory.
00542          * For clients with less memory, a larger fraction is needed
00543          * for other purposes (mostly for BGL). */
00544         if (totalram_pages <= 512 << (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT))
00545                 obd_max_dirty_pages = totalram_pages / 4;
00546         else
00547                 obd_max_dirty_pages = totalram_pages / 2;
00548 
00549         err = obd_init_caches();
00550         if (err)
00551                 return err;
00552         err = class_procfs_init();
00553         if (err)
00554                 return err;
00555 
00556         err = lu_global_init();
00557         if (err)
00558                 return err;
00559 
00560         err = cl_global_init();
00561         if (err != 0)
00562                 return err;
00563 
00564 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00565         err = dt_global_init();
00566         if (err != 0)
00567                 return err;
00568 
00569         err = lu_ucred_global_init();
00570         if (err != 0)
00571                 return err;
00572 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00573 
00574         err = llog_info_init();
00575         if (err)
00576                 return err;
00577 
00578         err = lustre_register_fs();
00579 
00580         return err;
00581 }
00582 
00583 void obd_update_maxusage(void)
00584 {
00585         __u64 max;
00586 
00587         max = obd_memory_sum();
00588 
00589         spin_lock(&obd_updatemax_lock);
00590         if (max > obd_max_alloc)
00591                 obd_max_alloc = max;
00592         spin_unlock(&obd_updatemax_lock);
00593 }
00594 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_update_maxusage);
00595 
00596 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00597 __u64 obd_memory_max(void)
00598 {
00599         __u64 ret;
00600 
00601         obd_update_maxusage();
00602         spin_lock(&obd_updatemax_lock);
00603         ret = obd_max_alloc;
00604         spin_unlock(&obd_updatemax_lock);
00605 
00606         return ret;
00607 }
00608 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00609 
00610 static void __exit obdclass_exit(void)
00611 {
00612         __u64 memory_leaked;
00613         __u64 memory_max;
00614         ENTRY;
00615 
00616         lustre_unregister_fs();
00617 
00618         misc_deregister(&obd_psdev);
00619         llog_info_fini();
00620 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00621         lu_ucred_global_fini();
00622         dt_global_fini();
00623 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00624         cl_global_fini();
00625         lu_global_fini();
00626 
00627         obd_cleanup_caches();
00628         obd_sysctl_clean();
00629 
00630         class_procfs_clean();
00631 
00632         class_handle_cleanup();
00633         class_exit_uuidlist();
00634         obd_zombie_impexp_stop();
00635         LASSERT(list_empty(&obd_stale_exports));
00636 
00637         memory_leaked = obd_memory_sum();
00638 
00639         memory_max = obd_memory_max();
00640 
00641         lprocfs_free_stats(&obd_memory);
00642         CDEBUG((memory_leaked) ? D_ERROR : D_INFO,
00643                "obd_memory max: "LPU64", leaked: "LPU64"\n",
00644                memory_max, memory_leaked);
00645 
00646         EXIT;
00647 }
00648 
00649 MODULE_AUTHOR("OpenSFS, Inc. <http://www.lustre.org/>");
00650 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre Class Driver");
00651 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
00652 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
00653 
00654 module_init(obdclass_init);
00655 module_exit(obdclass_exit);
